L. Sprague de Camp

American non- and speculative fiction writer

Upload mediaDate of birth27 November 1907

New York City

Lyon Sprague de CampDate of death6 November 2000

PlanoPlace of burialPseudonym

J. Wellington Wells

Work period (start)

1937

Country of citizenshipResidenceEducated atOccupationMother

Emma Beatrice de Camp

Spouse

Catherine Crook de Camp

Award received

Damon Knight Memorial Grand Master Award (1979)

World Fantasy Award for Life Achievement (1984)

Hugo Award for Best Related Work (1997)

Pilgrim Award (1998)

Fellow of the Committee for Skeptical Inquiry

Athenaeum Literary Award (1958)

International Fantasy Award

Lyon Sprague de Camp (27 November, 1907 – 6 November, 2000) was an American writer of science fiction, fantasy, non-fiction and biography. He was also a notable skeptic.

This category has only the following subcategory.
